content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function with first derivative <math alttext="f prime of x equals, negative 3 plus, the square root of x to the fourth power, plus x squared, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>. If <math alttext="f of 2 equals 1.572" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1.572</mn></mrow></math>, what is the value of <math alttext="f of 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 6.7: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Definite Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
